00020 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00021 
00022 //
00023 #include "chipstream/TableReader.h"
00024 //
00025 #include "util/Convert.h"
00026 #include "util/Err.h"
00027 #include "util/TableFile.h"
00028 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00029 //
00030 #include <vector>
00031 //
00032 
00033 using namespace std;
00034 /** 
00035  * @brief Read the file that contains the intensity data.
00036  * @return true if opened sucessfully, false otherwise.
00037  */
00038 bool TableReader::readFiles() {
00039   unsigned int clfIx = 0, colIx = 0, index = 0, rowIx = 0;
00040   /* Use this to pass data to streams and intensity marts. */
00041   vector<float> chip(m_ClfProbeCount);
00042   vector<int> clfMap(m_ClfProbeCount);
00043   
00044     /* Sanity check. */
00045   if(m_FileNames.size() != 1) {
00046     Err::errAbort("Can't have more than one text file.");
00047   }
00048 
00049   /* Read into a tablefile. This is inefficient, but easy for now
00050      as already coded. */
00051   TableFile tf;
00052   if(!m_RowColNames) {
00053     tf.setUseColNames(false);
00054     tf.setUseRowNames(false);
00055   }
00056   tf.open(m_FileNames[0].c_str());
00057   /* Make the map once (rather than looking up for each chip. */
00058   for(clfIx = 0; clfIx < clfMap.size(); clfIx++) {
00059     clfMap[clfIx] = tf.rowIndex(ToStr(clfIx).c_str());
00060   }
00061   Verbose::progressBegin(3, "Reading " + ToStr(m_FileNames.size()) + " Files", m_FileNames.size(), 0, m_FileNames.size());
00062   //Verbose::setDot(tf.numRows());
00063   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < tf.numRows(); rowIx++) {
00064     Verbose::progressStep(2);
00065     for(colIx = 0; colIx < tf.numCols(); colIx++) {
00066       float intensity = Convert::toFloat(tf.getData(rowIx, colIx).c_str());
00067       chip[colIx] = intensity;
00068     }
00069     /* Load data into our intensity marts. */
00070     for(index = 0; index < m_IntenMarts.size(); index++) 
00071       m_IntenMarts[index]->setProbeIntensity(rowIx, chip);
00072     /* Push data through our streams, have to make a new copy for
00073        each stream as it may get modified along the way. */
00074     for(index = 0; index < m_Streams.size(); index++) {
00075       std::vector<float> copy(chip);
00076       m_Streams[index]->newChip(copy);
00077     }
00078   }
00079   Verbose::progressEnd(2, "Done.");
00080   for(index = 0; index < m_Streams.size(); index++) {
00081     m_Streams[index]->endDataSet();
00082   } 
00083   m_Read = true;
00084   m_Passed = true;
00085   return true;
00086 }
